LangVersion.description: The version of the C# language the compiler should accept

type.default: The compiler accepts syntax from the latest major version it supports
type.preview: The compiler accepts syntax from the latest preview version it supports
type.latest: The compiler accepts syntax from the latest minor version it supports
type.latestMajor: The compiler accepts syntax from the latest major version it supports
type.ISO-1: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 1.0/1.1 and below, as specified in ISO/IEC 23270:2003
type.ISO-2: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 2.0 and below, as specified in ISO/IEC 23270:2006
type.3: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 3.0 and below
type.4: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 4.0 and below
type.5: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 5.0 and below
type.6: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 6.0 and below
type.7: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 7.0 and below
type.7.1: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 7.1 and below
type.7.2: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 7.2 and below
type.7.3: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 7.3 and below
type.8.0: The compiler accepts syntax from C# 8.0 and below

Deterministic.description: Enables reproducible builds, such that a given set of inputs will always produce byte-for-byte identical output

Nullable.description: The nullable context options for the project

nullableContextOptions.enable: Enable nullable annotation context and nullable warning context
nullableContextOptions.warnings: Enable nullable warning context but disable nullable annotation context
nullableContextOptions.annotations: Enable nullable annotation context but disable nullable warning context
nullableContextOptions.disable: Disable nullable annotation context and nullable warning context
